title: The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Lifestyle Accessories Winners
description: The 2025 Professional winner in Lifestyle Accessories is Aer1 System by Mark Wiggins in collaboration with Nathaniel Berman, JonPaul Turner, Scott Kingston, John Thorpe at Aerflo. The Aer1 system is a portable carbonation device consisting of three components: the Aer1 Carbonation Cap, the Aer1 Bottle, and the CO2 capsule. Users simply fill the bottle with water, load a capsule, and press the spritzing button at the top of the device to dispense CO2 and carbonate the water to their preference. The Student Lifestyle Accessories winner is Sirocco Hands-free Hairdryer by Yajurvi Haritwal from ArtCenter College of Design. Sirocco is a hands-free hair dryer designed to be easily accessible by everyone regardless of their level of upper limb mobility.The jury team for Lifestyle Accessories was led by Jury Captain Irina Kozlovskaya who is the Global Head of Industrial Design and CMF at ABB E-Mobility. Kozkivskaya's jury team included Annie Jean-Baptiste author of Building for Everyone and Founder and Director of Product Inclusion & Equity at Google, Kenneth Young the Founder and Creative Director at Now Studio, Quan Jasinski the Creative Director at Microsoft Surface Industrial Design, and Eliot Cohen Pirenne the Senior Design Director at Lululemon.The 2025 Lifestyle Accessories recognizes consumer products intended for use in daily life. Personal or home items that combine functionality and style, designed to complement an individual's daily routine, support wellness, enhance comfort, improve convenience, organization, and aesthetics including handheld products, luggage, desktop toys, jewelry, handbags, apparel, water bottles, or wearable devices.Lifestyle Accessories Award HonoreesPro WinnerAer1 SystemBy AerfloPro Runner UpARAY Heated RollerBy PensaPro Runner UpSharper Image: RealTouch Lumbar Acupressure Back MassagerBy Loft DesignPro NotableAway's Softside CollectionBy DerrisPro NotableE@niteBy PrototecPro NotableOZNIZ MAG 2 SunglassesBy Evolve CollaborativePro NotableThe Swatch BagBy two-pointStudent WinnerSirocco Hands-free HairdryerBy Yajurvi HaritwalStudent Runner UpAttention ReceiptsBy Anup SathyaStudent Runner UpMess EnsembleBy Shu WangStudent NotableExpressInkBy Allison ChenStudent NotablesitreliefBy Yinyi LongStudent NotableSUVVIBy Yihang XuSee All The Honorees of the 2025 Core77 Design Awards Here:Apps & Platforms | Built Environment | Branding | Commercial & Industrial Equipment | Consumer Technology | Design for Social Impact | Emerging Technologies | Furniture & Lighting | Home & Living | Interaction | Lifestyle Accessories | Medical & Healthcare | Packaging | Speculative Design | Sports & Outdoor | Sustainability | Tools | Toys & Play | Transportation | Visual Communication

html:
The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Lifestyle Accessories Winners

This year's Lifestyle Accessories jury was led by Irina Kozlovskaya the Global Head of Industrial Design and CMF at ABB E Mobility

The 2025 Professional winner in Lifestyle Accessories is Aer1 System by Mark Wiggins in collaboration with Nathaniel Berman, JonPaul Turner, Scott Kingston, John Thorpe at Aerflo. The Aer1 system is a portable carbonation device consisting of three components: the Aer1 Carbonation Cap, the Aer1 Bottle, and the CO2 capsule. Users simply fill the bottle with water, load a capsule, and press the spritzing button at the top of the device to dispense CO2 and carbonate the water to their preference.

The Student Lifestyle Accessories winner is Sirocco Hands-free Hairdryer by Yajurvi Haritwal from ArtCenter College of Design. Sirocco is a hands-free hair dryer designed to be easily accessible by everyone regardless of their level of upper limb mobility.

The jury team for Lifestyle Accessories was led by Jury Captain Irina Kozlovskaya who is the Global Head of Industrial Design and CMF at ABB E-Mobility. Kozkivskaya's jury team included Annie Jean-Baptiste author of Building for Everyone and Founder and Director of Product Inclusion & Equity at Google, Kenneth Young the Founder and Creative Director at Now Studio, Quan Jasinski the Creative Director at Microsoft Surface Industrial Design, and Eliot Cohen Pirenne the Senior Design Director at Lululemon.

The 2025 Lifestyle Accessories recognizes consumer products intended for use in daily life. Personal or home items that combine functionality and style, designed to complement an individual's daily routine, support wellness, enhance comfort, improve convenience, organization, and aesthetics including handheld products, luggage, desktop toys, jewelry, handbags, apparel, water bottles, or wearable devices.
